In 2022-2023, the top three boroughs with the most library events are Hackney, Lambeth, and Southwark, hosting 50% of all events.
Library funding per capita is highest in Kensington and Chelsea, 30% above the London average in 2022-2023.
In 2022-2023, libraries in the boroughs of Greenwich and Lewisham have the lowest average book circulation, 20% below the London average.
Central London boroughs, including Westminster and Camden, show a clustering of libraries with high digital resource usage in 2022-2023.

categorical_analysis.proposition: In 2022-2023, 'Community Events' is the most common category of library activities, representing 40% of all activities.
Educational programs in libraries are more concentrated in Inner London boroughs, accounting for 60% of such programs in 2022-2023.
Digital resource usage is the least common category, making up only 10% of library activities in Outer London in 2022-2023.
In 2022-2023, 'Reading Clubs' are twice as prevalent in South London boroughs compared to North London.

statistical_patterns.proposition: The distribution of library visits across London boroughs in 2022-2023 is positively skewed, with a few boroughs having significantly higher visits.
There is a strong positive correlation between library funding and visitor numbers in 2022-2023, with a correlation coefficient of 0.75.
In 2022-2023, the variance in library event attendance is highest in Inner London boroughs, indicating diverse engagement levels.
